This is the earliest puff for Flaxman’s Hesiod (1817); the others are all in 1817—Literary Panorama, Edinburgh Review, and New Monthly Magazine—and all misidentify the engraver as “J. Blake.” The first payment to Blake for his engravings was in September 1814, but Flaxman’s contract with Longman was not signed until 24 February 1816 (BR[2] 771-72).
